alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 5:39AM EST until February 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Pikeville affecting Pike County. Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Paintsville affecting Johnson County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Pikeville. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 31.9 feet this evening and then recede. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EST.
